content.description: Start on a massive jug undercling and manuever out a crack like dihedral feature via slopers and crimps. Sustained till you reach the lip.
content.location: In the heart of the Sky Cave

content.description: A true Elden Classic. Climb out the roof (yes roof) on cool pinches and jugs to a committing off-width dihedral top-out. Beautiful line!
content.protection: Pads & a #1 if you like placing gear. (not recommended)
content.location: Hike past the Skyline boulders, and make your way for an extremely large Snag. The Sky Cave is right below the snag.

content.description: Start on a left undercling ad good right crimp, climb through a few small edges to an awesome sloper rail, make your way around to the left and finish clinging to small edges on high quality stone.
content.location: On the free-standing boulder directly behind Triple Lundee

content.description:
Sit start on good holds - traverse the lip to a large move out to good holds in a seam. Top out on the apex of the boulder.

https://vimeo.com/154257954
content.location: Above the sky cave - approximately 5 minute walk up and left

content.description: Start on an obvious jug, make moves up the face to an easy topout.
content.location: From the Sky Cave hike up and around to the west, as you approach the Mantis boulder, traverse to the east for Rum Ham.

content.description: Sit start as for Mrs. Mantis but instead of following the arete climb out right to the big jug in the roof. Make a few compression moves up the right side of the arete to a slot jug and top out to the right. Somewhat contrived but adds a few cool moves out the steep.
content.location: Up the Hill from Sky Cave.

content.description: Sit start on a massive jug hueco, climb straight up the face on crimps - a variation climbs out right and finishes on better rock.
content.location: On the way up to the Sky cave this boulder is in a small corridor - good luck!

content.description: Sit start on lowest compression holds... Slap and toe hook your way out the arete to a good hold and finish out the headwall.
content.location: From the Sky Cave, hike up and around to the west on rocky slabs. As you approach larger boulders, the Mantis boulder is on the far west side, hard to miss.

content.description: Stand start on opposing side pulls - utilizing some foot trickery gain a decent edge and make a toss to a decent hold on the lip, easy top out.
content.location: As you walk into the cave The moat is the first problem on the left. When water is running you will have to step across the moat to pull on.

content.description: Sit Start on opposing slopers - Slap your way up the mini-prow to gain a huge pocket - climb up and left for an easier top out or straight up if you want some spice.
content.location: Approximately 800 feet below the Sky Cave on the main trail.

content.description: Stand start on a huge fin undercling climb out the roof via holds in the roof as well as a prow feature eventually leading to a jug on the headwall. Grab a shake and climb the intimidating vert headwall over a less than ideal landing. A route grade may be more suitable for this climb, a pumpy test of determination.
content.protection: I would recommend 6+ pads, a spotter and rehearsing the headwall.
content.location: Review directions for The Sky Cave, Hoodwink climbs out the steepest part of the roof leading to a water polished headwall. Tough to miss.

content.description: Stand start on good holds in the seam - climb straight up

Awesome cave approximately 1/3 of the way up Mount Elden. Nice water polished stone and multiple free standing blocks to play on. Please be safe up here, a serious injury would result in a very difficult extraction.
